title: Preserving Lumiere
creator_contributor_role: National Film and Sound Archive of Australia, production company

Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Film archives
abstract: A short film demonstrating the expertise of specialist staff at the National Film and Sound Archive.  Includes artefacts from the Marius Sestier family collection, and a detailed account of the Lumiere Collection, its restoration and significance, filmed by Marius Sestier in Australia between 1896 and 1897.
description: Marius Sestier was one of 23 Freres Lumiere/operator representatives who travelled the world and made a total of 19 films whilst working in Australia between 1896 and 1897. This film shows century-old film from the Lumiere Collection being meticulously prepared and restored, in readiness for photochemical film reproduction and preservation. Also shown is the extensive restoration work required for documents and photographs prior to being digitally preserved for the National Film and Sound Archive's collection.
